intro: Mentzelia cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and delicate blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its growth habit is often low and sprawling, with stems that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. Mentzelia cordifolia is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is known for its ornamental value and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
